snippet: As one of President Ronald Reagan’s most trusted advisers, Mr. Clark nudged him toward more hard-line positions on military spending, arms control and involvement in Central America.
abstract: William P Clark, who as one of President Ronald Reagan’s most trusted advisers successfully nudged him toward more hard-line positions on military spending, arms control and involvement in Central America, dies at age 81.
lead_paragraph: As one of President Ronald Reagan’s most trusted advisers, Mr. Clark nudged him toward more hard-line positions on military spending, arms control and involvement in Central America.

headline.main: William P. Clark, Influential Adviser in Reagan White House, Is Dead at 81
